newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Apr 21-30 IGP-M index drops 0.02 pct.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Apr 21-30 IGP-M index drops 0.02 pct.

text.p: Brazil's IGP-M inflation index dropped 0.02 percent between April 21 and April 30, compared with a 0.27 percent rise between March 21 and March 31, the Getulio Vargas Foudation (FGV) said Thursday.
The IGP-M is composed of three other economic indicators.

They are the IPA wholesale price index, which dropped 0.10 percent in the period; the IPC consumer price index, which rose 0.03 percent in the period, and the INCC national index of construction costs, which gained 0.26 percent.
The IPA has a 60 percent weighting, the IPC a 30 percent weighting and the INCC 10 percent, the FGV said.
The IGP-M index, which measures inflation over ten-day intervals is published by the independent research institute Fundacao Getulio Vargas (FGV).
